results.title: France panorama. [No. 66/50]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: Christmas in Paris - Highlights the various French customs involved with celebrating Christmas including the consuming of shellfish, decorating the city streets and shop fronts, and attending Church. Also includes images of the homeless in Paris being given special packages for this festive date.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 65?/38]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Le Paquebot des sables - Shows a dredge in South France preparing for the beaching of the liner ‘Lydia’. 2. Le Monde de Miro - shows paintings on cardboard by artist Joan Miro. 3. Sports nautiques - coverage of French water-skiers. 4. Vu pour voux - a look at Americans in Gourin in Britanny, north-west France. 5. Two views of Paris in August - 6.00am and 9.00am and special luxury cattery in Parisian suburb.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 65/23]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. L’Europe on marche - economic summit between English Prime Minister, Edward Heath, and the French President. 2. Technique - new waterways and converting earth and rock into liquid gases. 3. Bibliotheque pilote - a new state of the art library . 4. Un Prix Nobel a Pasteur - a Nobel prize winner at the Pasteur Institute of Science. 5. Les ailes et la musique - wings and music.

results.title: Four men of India
results.brief_description: Life in widely different regions of India is illustrated by the backgrounds of four typical Hindustan Lever employees, in Calcutta, Kerala, the Kulu Valley and Rajasthan.

results.title: Forever James Dean
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the short career of screen legend James Dean. Features loads of stills, his first screen appearance for ‘Pepsi’ and clips and trailers of his three feature films: “East of Eden”, “Rebel without a cause” and “Giant”. Contains some contemporary interviews and features a song written for the film made in the 1980s. Narrated by Bob Gunton.

results.title: Forestry in South Africa
results.creator_credit: Film Services and South African Government
results.brief_description: Stresses the economic importance of timber. Surveys the limited areas of indigenous forests to be found in South Africa which are of any commercial value; portrays various forest activities including re-afforestation; nursery plantation, transplantation; removal of unwanted growths; thinning; protection against fire; felling; mill sawing.

results.title: Forest treasures
results.creator_credit: Gunnar Skoglund and A-B Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: Documentary about logging 250 year-old trees in Sweden and their journey by river and road to the mills. Some are made into planks, other timber is pulped. This pulp is processed into newsprint and paper but some is made into viscose and ends up as manmade silk and rayon. Sweden was a leader in this technique.

results.title: For you madam. [No. 70/12] = Pour vous madame
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine item on French perfumes. Shows the travels of perfume from Gras to Paris. First the flowers are picked, the essential oils pressed out then distilling in a warehouse. In the laboratory these are mixed by “the hose”. We then see bottles being bvlown ready for the perfume. Each designer has a perfume and we see the dress and the finished bottle. However it takes 160 people to produce 9,000 bottles a day. Designers appearing on film include Dior, Givenchy, Guy La Roche, Chanel etc.
